intro: Calamus erectus var. birmanicus, commonly known as the Burmese arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Aroid family (Araceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender rhizomes that can reach several meters in length. The plant produces large,戟-shaped leaves with a smooth, waxy surface and is often found in wetland or marshy habitats. Its rhizomes are harvested for their starchy content, which is used in traditional medicine and as a food source. The plant also has ornamental value due to its striking foliage and unique inflorescence.
